creator: lmarlow@yahoo.com
text:
StarTeam allows properties to be prefetched to avoid a lot of network chatter 
back and forth with the server.  By using the Folder.populateNow() method, I 
have seen significant performance increases for checkouts and listings.  I will 
attach a patch that enables this speedup.

Created attachment 4305
checkout and listing performance increase
creator: lmarlow@yahoo.com
scohen@apache.org
text:
This looks like a well-motivated patch.  I want to do a little testing on it
before asking for it to be committed.  I am sorry that this patch and the
previous one you submitted were missed by me.

creator: lmarlow@yahoo.com
text:
Just to let you know, I have been running ant with these patches for over 3 
months now with no problems.

Created attachment 5915
Essentially the same as Mr. Marlow's patch but adds documentation and is made against the latest code tree.
creator: scohen@apache.org
scohen@apache.org
text:
I have tested this patch (sorry for delay) and find it to work and to deliver 
as advertised.  I have made a new patch, though, to diff against the latest 
code tree, and also to add documentation about the new functionality. 
 
Committer should therefore ignore the 12/31/02 patch and commit the 4/20/03 
patch. 
 
Thank you very much, Mr. Marlow.

Fix in CVS, Thanks

Steve can you verify that it's working in the next nightly build?

Jesse
creator: stockall@magma.ca
scohen@apache.org
text:
I can't verify that it's working in the nightly build because the starteam 
classes are not included in the optional.jar that's part of the nightly build. 
(Why not? - is this a residue of the time about a month ago when it wouldn't 
build?  I told Stefan Bodewig at the time where to get the proper 
starteam-sdk.jar to make it build.) 
 
I can verify that the new code and documentation made it into cvs.  (I noticed 
that you removed one import statement from the patch that wasn't needed.) 
Later, I'll rebuild the source and verify.

creator: scohen@apache.org
text:
Ok, I've now built from the CVS repository (since the nightly build doesn't 
contain its code and I can verify that it works) so I am marking this one 
fixed.
